tool.name: CalculateConstantValue
tool.displayname: Calculate Constant Value into a Field in a Table

param.name: Feature Class
param.dialogReference: Select a feature class or table from which the field calculation will be performed

param.name: Field to be Updated
param.displayname: Select the Field to Be Updated with the Constant Value
param.dialogReference: Select the field which will be updated with a constant value

param.name: Constant Value to use in the Field Calcutation
param.displayname: Constant Value to use in the Field Calcutation
param.expression: Constant Value to use in the Field Calcutation
param.dialogReference: Enter a constant value that will be used to populate every record in the field that you selected.

param.name: Data Type of the Constant Entered
param.dialogReference: Select a value from the drop down that represents the data type of the constant entered into the previous parameter of this tool.

param.name: Update SQL Query
param.displayname: Optional SQL Query to Perform on the Table Before Field Calculation
param.dialogReference: An optional SQL query that will allow you to make selections so only certain records will have field calculations performed on them. E.g., "Elevation >4000", will result in a selection of records that have elevation greater than 4000 and only these records will have a field calculation performed on them.

idCitation.resTitle: Calculate Constant Value into a Field in a Table
